summary: This is an email chain between defense attorneys and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding discovery requests in the case of Nicholas Tartaglione, who was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate. The correspondence discusses requests for evidence related to the July 22-23, 2019 incident involving Epstein and Tartaglione in the MCC's SHU, with the government providing responses and offering access to a 53-page BOP investigative report.

persons.name: Bruce Barket

events.title: Epstein-Tartaglione Cell Incident
events.description: Incident involving Jeffrey Epstein and his cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione in the SHU at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Scheduled Conference
events.description: Upcoming conference mentioned in the email, for which the BOP investigative report could be made available in advance.

locations: Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP, 666 Old Country Road, Ste. 700, Garden City, NY 11530
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
White Plains office (of the U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office confirmed no audio/video recordings, documentation on the cell assignment decision, or After Action Report exists regarding the July 22-23, 2019 incident involving Epstein and Tartaglione.
A 53-page BOP investigative report related to the incident was compiled and made available for Attorney's Eyes Only review, with minimal redactions.
The defense was seeking evidence including video surveillance outside the cells and photographs of the cell and the inmates following the incident.
The correspondence indicates an ongoing investigation into whether BOP conducted any investigation of Tartaglione as a result of allegations made by Epstein.
The email chain is dated December 2019, after Epstein's death, and concerns discovery for the penalty phase in Tartaglione's case.
